message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.CR, cs.SY

This paper deals with the design and analysis of a novel medium access control (MAC) protocol for wireless local area networks (WLANs) that integrates sub-6 GHz and millimeter wave (mmW) communications. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also involves the analysis of the performance of the proposed protocol, which involves the use of advanced multi-band wireless stations (STAs) and the consideration of the intermittent channel at the 60 GHz band and the level of congestion observed over the sub-6 GHz bands. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with the use of mmW communications, which is a topic of interest in the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category. The paper also considers the security aspects of the proposed protocol, which may place it in the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the design of a novel MAC protocol, which may also place it in the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category.
